programme.title: My Cat from Hell

programme.title: Lone Star Law

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: An Eskimo dog arrives with a broken jaw, and Dr Jeff must uncover the cause. He and Dr Nichols also have their hands full treating some uncooperative yaks

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: The return of the reality show following the lives of Alaskan family the Kilchers. In the first episode, the family faces the fallout from the warmest winter in decades, as Atz Lee and Elvin tackle an emergency mission to secure their cabins at the head of the bay

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People

programme.title: Fish or Die
programme.desc: The anglers follow a lead to a remote river in Greenland, believed to hold huge Arctic char. They also investigate a myth of Atlantic salmon occupying a lone river

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Wayde and Brett build a 1,500-gallon aquarium in the ceiling of a hotel, along with a tank for worldwide internet sensation Henri the cat

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators from the Houston SPCA are called to a remote property, where they find five horses - one dead and four in poor health

programme.desc: The family continue Steves mission by making their annual trip to the Steve Irwin Wildlife Reserve to study wild crocodiles

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: Hurricane season is approaching and Tia prepares for the worst. Villalobos employee Rico takes on a new duty when his grandparents adopt a shy dog

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Jackson helps a good cat stand up to its two feline attackers. He also meets a couple fed up with their cats eating everything in sight

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Jackson Galaxy visits a house divided, with four cats always fighting. He also helps out at a cattery where territorial issues have two cats to live in isolation for years

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: The marine team hunt for a foreign cargo vessel in the Gulf of Mexico. A man is suspected of pouching deer out of season and the wardens inspect a drug operation

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and Dr Petra work together to save a beloved pet huskys leg. Specialist Dr Baier has a scare during the routine treatment of a pet pig

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: A friend asks Pete Nelson to build him a treehouse strictly for fun and relaxation, so he creates a space complete with a wine bar, loft and even a hot tub

programme.title: Guardians of Rescue
programme.desc: Moose and Elle confront a man accused of animal abuse, while Rob and Dori try to rescue a dog from its chain. Brian and Amanda meet a homeless veteran and his dogs

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Atz Lee and Shane struggle to move a two-ton bridge to ensure crossing of glacial rivers, while Otto and Charlotte fight a serious threat to their cattle

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Wolfpack kids have divided their land between themselves, and they are all desperate to finish building their houses in time. Meanwhile, Noah prepares for the babys arrival

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Age of Steam
programme.desc: The development of the steamship, from the earliest paddle boats and the first iron-hulled vessels to modern sport screw propellers and ships powered by steam turbines, such as the Royal Yacht Britannia

programme.title: Railway Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury begins the longest walk yet, a journey through the Highlands over territory with a history of clan conflict and links with folk hero Rob Roy. Many travellers avoided the area due to stories of violent encounters, until the arrival of the railway changed the landscape

programme.title: Pillow Talk
programme.desc: A man and woman who have never met squabble about each others use of a shared telephone line. One day their paths cross by chance and he is instantly smitten with her. Quickly realising who she really is, he poses as a perfect gentleman from the South to woo her. Romantic comedy, starring Rock Hudson, Doris Day, Tony Randall, Thelma Ritter, Nick Adams and Julia Meade

programme.title: Lover Come Back
programme.desc: Advertising executive Carol Templeton is determined to outdo her competitor Jerry Webster at every opportunity. When an important campaign comes up, she tries to beat him to it and clinch the deal, whatever the price. Unfortunately for her, she fails to realise the whole thing is a set-up devised by her hated rival. Romantic comedy, starring Doris Day, Rock Hudson, Tony Randall, Edie Adams and Jack Oakie

programme.title: Wogan
programme.sub-title: David Jason, Jennifer DAbo and Rock Hudson
programme.desc: Terry Wogan sits down for interviews with actor David Jason, British entrepreneur Jennifer DAbo and American movie star Rock Hudson. First broadcast 22 September 1984

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A 1993 documentary exploring three decades of Soviet space culture,from the glory days of Yuri Gagarin to the saga of cosmonaut Sergei Krikalev, whose return from the Mir space station was delayed due to the dissolution of the Soviet Union

programme.title: The Magic of Mushrooms
programme.desc: Richard Fortey examines the world of mushrooms in a specially built laboratory with the help of mycologist Patrick Hickey. Together, they reveal the ability of fungi to break down waste and sustain new plant life, keeping the planet alive. Richard also travels across Britain and further afield to reveal their mysterious life cycles and how they have the potential to open new frontiers in science, medicine and technology

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Age of Steam
programme.desc: The development of the steamship, from the earliest paddle boats and the first iron-hulled vessels to modern sport screw propellers and ships powered by steam turbines, such as the Royal Yacht Britannia

programme.title: Railway Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury begins the longest walk yet, a journey through the Highlands over territory with a history of clan conflict and links with folk hero Rob Roy. Many travellers avoided the area due to stories of violent encounters, until the arrival of the railway changed the landscape

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 16 October 1998. Featuring B*Witched, 911, Garbage, The Cardigans, Monica, Natalie Imbruglia, Fatboy Slim and Billie Piper

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 23 October 1998. Featuring 911, Cliff Richard, Meja, REM, Billie Piper, Dru Hill, George Michael and Spacedust

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: David Jensen presents an edition first broadcast November 15, 1979. Includes performances by the Jam, Cliff Richard, Thin Lizzy, BA Robertson, Suzi Quatro, the Moody Blues, Kool and the Gang, Secret Affair, the Ramblers, Showaddywaddy and Dr Hook. Plus, dance sequences by Legs and Co

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Gary Davies and Susie Mathis present the pop chart programme first broadcast on 17 November 1988. Featuring Yazz, All About Eve, INXS, Mica Paris, Tanita Tikaram, Robin Beck and Salt-N-Pepa

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Steve Wright presents the pop chart show, first broadcast on 19 November 1981. Featuring Modern Romance, The Pretenders, Fun Boy Three, ABC, Trevor Walters, Julio Iglesias, Diana Ross, Soft Cell and Zoo

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Claudia Simon and Tony Dortie present the programme, first broadcast on 14 November 1991 and featuring performances by Rozalla, Seal, Tina Turner, Altern-8, Michael Jackson, REM and Vic Reeves and the Wonderstuff

programme.title: The Songs of Nick Drake: Way to Blue
programme.desc: Highlights of a concert celebrating the singer-songwriters music at the Barbican Centre in London, curated by legendary producer Joe Boyd. Leading artists present their interpretations of his tracks, including Vashti Bunyan, Green Gartside, Lisa Hannigan, Scott Matthews, Teddy Thompson and Krystle Warren.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Including electric performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, David Bowie, Motorhead, Nazareth, AC/DC and George Thorogood, as well as acoustic material by Michael Chapman, Horslips and Paco de Lucia

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Top of the Pops and The Old Grey Whistle Test, featuring Alice Cooper, New York Dolls, Peter Green, Queen, Robin Trower, John Martyn, Whitesnake, Joan Jett and Black Sabbath

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Pete Townshend of the Who, acoustic numbers by Davy Graham and Ralph McTell, and the talents of Americans Nils Lofgren and Ted Nugent. Also featured are performances by the Faces, Chris Spedding, the Runaways, Judas Priest, ZZ Top and the Cate Brothers

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 16 October 1998. Featuring B*Witched, 911, Garbage, The Cardigans, Monica, Natalie Imbruglia, Fatboy Slim and Billie Piper

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 23 October 1998. Featuring 911, Cliff Richard, Meja, REM, Billie Piper, Dru Hill, George Michael and Spacedust

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Kym Marsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: Excluded from Cheap Energy Tariffs Because of Where I Live
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Louise Minchin and Julia Somerville meet the homeowners who discovered they were victims of a north-south divide for smart meters - which meant they couldnt access the best tariffs for charging their new electric vehicles

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts heads to Wales, where a mixed commercial and residential unit is in surprisingly good condition. Jacqui Josephs house in Norwich is in similarly decent nick. Dion Dublin, meanwhile, is in Staffordshire where a three-bedroom mid-terrace has a quirky layout to contend with

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents this contest from the Herefordshire market town of Leominster, where experts Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell guide two teams around an antiques centre seeking items of value. As well as keeping an eye on proceedings, Eric also visits one of the oldest teddy bear factories in the United Kingdom

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.sub-title: You Will Get a Call from the Police, OK
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Nick Stapleton take on scammers posing as police who are using fake recordings of walkie-talkie chatter to frighten their targets into believing they really are talking to the authorities. To avoid suspicion of the very paranoid and aggressive group, the ground interceptors take charge

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: After studying the art of shoemaking at university, Sonia swapped her creative passion for a teaching job while raising her daughter. Now the child is older, Sonia is hoping to make a comeback to the craft she loves and make a living from making shoes. Andy Bates helps this talented maker find the confidence she needs to get herself and her work out there. Weaver Shiv needs help to get out of a sales slump. Having found success in the past, shes hoping mentor Piyush Suri can figure out how to get her back on track. Presented by Dominic Chinea

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Briony May Williams helps members of a young family who have outgrown their London flat and now need a new home in rural Suffolk with enough room for two growing children. The exciting property line-up includes a mystery house that has six centuries of stories to tell - some written on its walls. Briony is also excited to meet a fellow baking enthusiast who, after making his own escape to the county a year ago, now sells cakes and runs a supper club from his home

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull head to Penarth to transform Hannah and Gemmas overgrown and unloved plot into a Tulum Jungle Bar garden. They are hoping for a sophisticated and exotic space that echoes some of their travels, particularly their trips to Mexico. All this is hoped to be achieved on a £5,000 budget

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: In Oxfordshire, Phil Serrell gets nostalgic with a tabletop game that brings back memories of his youth, though hes never too old to bend the rules to win. His opponent Tahmina Ghaffar takes a bold gamble on a large piece of mid-century furniture and an intriguing item designed to help the visually impaired, hoping both will guide the way to a profit. Taking a break from the shops, the duo also dive into Britains rich brewing heritage

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Alfie apologises to Zoe for doubting her, and they find an earring in the barrel store, which Zoe is convinced must belong to her tormentor. Oscar continues to pursue Jasmine, but is shocked when she steals Anthonys surgery keys

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams race from the surf mecca El Zonte on the Pacific coast across the entirety of El Salvador, known as the land of volcanoes, before entering Honduras to reach the third checkpoint, the colonial mountain town of Valle de Angeles. With the gap between teams reduced to just three and a half hours, Anita Rani and Bal Nazran are first to depart, eager to maintain their lead. However, Roman and Harleymoon Kemp hatch a plan to steal first place, by speeding along the coast to enter Honduras by sea

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining four celebrity cooks pair up for a challenge in which both duos must deliver two plates of food that look and taste identical. But with only one of each team having access to the recipe, communication is key. Then its back to cooking solo as they serve up two courses for a panel comprising former Celebrity MasterChef champions Lisa Faulkner and Angellica Bell and finalist Danny Jones. Presented by Grace Dent and John Torode

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers reviews the weeks political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in the Leicestershire town of Loughborough to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A panel of BBC journalists hosts a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley, Maisie Adam, Oti Mabuse, Asim Chaudhry, Ricky Wilson, Omid Djalili and Joey Essex join in the fun on the game show in which contestants answer questions with the aid of celebrity experts - aware that one wrong answer means someone else gets a chance

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Gaby Roslin host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.sub-title: Our Holiday Was Not as Advertised
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Gloria Hunniford, and Louise Minchin investigate the cases of holiday-makers who say the reality of their trips was far from what was advertised by the travel company, including the Sicilian hotel that turned out to be a four-hour walk from the historic city. Plus, advice on investing in a campervan conversion and tips for using a mobile abroad without facing a costly bill

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.sub-title: Good Things Come in Small Packages
programme.desc: Martin Roberts contemplates whether a house in Wales is the smallest he has ever encountered in his 20 years on the programme. Dion Dublin is captivated by a rather funky, retro carpet in a terrace in Lancashire, while Tommy Walsh is in Wandsworth, south London, where a one-bedroom garden flat has potential to add space

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Ardingly, West Sussex, band mates Henry and Oscar, with their expert Danny Sebastian, take on competitive couple Nina and Rakesh, advised by Kate Bliss. Host Natasha Raskin Sharp monitors the contest and also meets an artist who can make his masterpieces disappear. Martin Frost creates amazing vanishing fore edge paintings on the unbound edges of a books pages, which are only visible when the pages are fanned out

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When one of the lads in a local rugby team is attacked, Donal wonders if its a case of jealousy between the players or whether theres something more serious going on. Marlene and Eve arent getting on, so when Marlene sees Eves husband looking intimate with another woman, she wonders what she should do. Cameron Cuffe, Kerri Quinn and Tara Lynne ONeill star

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple from the Surrey town of Epsom enjoy the spectacular landscape in Argyll and Bute as Nicki Chapman provides them with some expert property advice. For their budget of £600,000 they want a house with views that just keep on giving. Nicki also takes to the water on Loch Lomond, to meet a family who have owned and lived on an island for 70 years

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Flo Headlam head to Doncaster to transform John and Alasdairs bland new-build garden into a Eurovision-winning garden. The pair would love a garden that embraces their love of Eurovision, whether through literal flags and themed colours of participating countries or something more esoteric. The team needs to achieve all this on a £3,750 budget

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Phil Serrell and Tahmina Ghaffar enjoy the last leg of their trip in Cornwall. Tahmina goes gaga for a polished stone that reveals a naturally formed landscape scene and is drawn to a pair of royal souvenirs with regal charm. Meanwhile, Phil uncovers a mystery metal kitchen gadget with a surprisingly unusual purpose. Away from the shops, the duo take a detour into the tropics - without leaving the UK - as they explore one of the worlds largest greenhouses and discover the wonders of a man-made rainforest. With their final auction looming, the pressure is well-and-truly on

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong. with guest co-host Mel Giedroyc

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo co-hosts the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Farm 999
programme.sub-title: High Stakes GPS Sting and a Life Saved by Air Ambulance
programme.desc: Police close in on an organised crime gang targeting farms across northern England and stealing high-tech GPS systems. After months of painstaking detective work, a high stakes sting operation is launched to bring the thieves to justice. In Leicestershire, a huge barn fire devastates a family run dairy farm, threatening cattle and destroying winter feed. In Scotland, reporter Paul Colgan meets farmer Debbie Duffus, as she is reunited with the air ambulance team who saved her life

programme.title: Return to Paradise
programme.desc: The CEO of a dating app is poisoned during a spiritual ceremony at a corporate retreat, yet no one else drinking the same psychedelic tea was affected. As Mackenzie Clarke tracks a pattern of deception, she finds herself in a world even murkier and more sordid than murder - online dating. Drama, starring Anna Samson and Lloyd Griffith

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Gabby Logan hosts, as comedian Nish Kumar and journalist Cathy Newman join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton. As usual, all concerned poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Sitcom about a father and daughter reunited when the latter falls pregnant. Exhausted Gemma, living with her three-month-old daughter, sees her formerly estranged mother Davina move in. Instead of helping, her mum lives an irritatingly carefree life. Meanwhile, father Malcolm is living back at the bedsit, sleeping on an inflatable bed on the landing. Missing her dad and in a state of despair, Gemma conspires with Malcolm and Derek to hatch a plot to oust Davina. Starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The Blame Game
programme.desc: Tim McGarry, Colin Murphy, Diona Doherty and Neil Delamere are joined by guest Kerry Godliman for the panel show taking a sideways look at the weeks news. Comedy asides and good craic abound as they turn their wit and satirical spin on the people and events who are making the news in Northern Ireland and beyond

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Hollywood stars Hugh Jackman and Kate Hudson, who play a Neil Diamond tribute act in the biographical drama Song Sung Blue. Comic actor Ben Stiller discusses Stiller and Meara: Nothing Is Lost, his documentary about his comedy-duo parents Jerry Stiller and Anne Meara, while Oscar-winner DaVine Joy Randolph reflects on her afterlife romcom Eternity. Plus, American singer-songwriter Sombr performs his current single 12 to 12

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The search for the UKs Next Drag Race Superstar is nearly over, and Mama Ru is testing the queens comedy chops with a challenge that has seen many a well-seasoned queen fall at the last hurdle, the comedy roast - and this one comes with an added new-age twist. Comedian, writer and actor Sophie Willan is on hand to help coach the queens and joins Ru, Michelle Visage, and Alan Carr on the judging panel as the contestants vie for a much coveted place in the final

programme.title: Tell Me Lies
programme.sub-title: Did Your Dirty Words Comes Out to Play?
programme.desc: At Evan and Brees rehearsal dinner in the present day, tensions swirl beneath the celebrations. Lucy sneaks off to hook up with Max, deliberately luring Stephen to catch her. Flashbacks reveal messy Thanksgiving drama when a snowed-in campus forces everyone to Evans for dinner, Thriller, starring Grace Van Patten, Branden Cook and Catherine Missal

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Rattus launches his own radio station - BBC Radio Number Two - assisted in his endeavours by social media star Holly H. Together they amass a collection of some of the best songs of this series, plus new material from some of the famous historical faces met along the way

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes host a Strictly Come Dancing-themed episode of the music-based quiz show. Contestants Ranvir Singh, Chizzy Akudolu, Ore Oduba, Joanne Clifton, Ian Waite and Karim Zeroual must name as many hit songs and artists as possible under intense pressure, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs for their chosen charity

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Friends James and Amy from Chingford, sisters Angelika and Annabel, also from London, and engaged couple Jody and Mike from Cwmbran, Monmouthshire, attempt to win £10,000, while Alan Carr asks the questions

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The search for the UKs Next Drag Race Superstar is nearly over, and Mama Ru is testing the queens comedy chops with a challenge that has seen many a well-seasoned queen fall at the last hurdle, the comedy roast - and this one comes with an added new-age twist. Comedian, writer and actor Sophie Willan is on hand to help coach the queens and joins Ru, Michelle Visage, and Alan Carr on the judging panel as the contestants vie for a much coveted place in the final

programme.title: Men of the Manosphere
programme.desc: James Blake enters the virtual world of manhood, often referred to as the manosphere, in search of status, wealth and relationships. He meets three young men who have turned to male social media influencers for guidance and instruction as they seek to better themselves and achieve success in different areas of their lives, both on and offline

programme.title: The Eubanks: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: Former boxing star Chris Eubank and his son Chris Eubank Jr, who followed his father into the sport, are reunited after years apart to confront their fractured past. The film follows the pair as they explore their legacy, grief and the emotional cost of a life in the ring

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a race from Londons Wembley Stadium to Milans San Siro, the home of Italian football giants AC and Inter. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of £35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyotas GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Kia Ceed through a rigorous but peculiar road test featuring eels, curry, a rock legend, an American police officer and an unusual game of rugby involving James May. Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the Mastretta MXT, but worries about the repercussions of a comment he made in a previous episode about Mexico, the sports cars country of manufacture. Plus, three high-performance hatchbacks are driven with gusto around the test track, and Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton gets a second chance to smash the lap record

programme.title: Men of the Manosphere
programme.desc: James Blake enters the virtual world of manhood, often referred to as the manosphere, in search of status, wealth and relationships. He meets three young men who have turned to male social media influencers for guidance and instruction as they seek to better themselves and achieve success in different areas of their lives, both on and offline

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: The search for the UKs Next Drag Race Superstar is nearly over, and Mama Ru is testing the queens comedy chops with a challenge that has seen many a well-seasoned queen fall at the last hurdle, the comedy roast - and this one comes with an added new-age twist. Comedian, writer and actor Sophie Willan is on hand to help coach the queens and joins Ru, Michelle Visage, and Alan Carr on the judging panel as the contestants vie for a much coveted place in the final

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Wallace and Gromit: A Grand Day Out
programme.desc: Nick Parks Bafta-winning film which introduced the animated inventor and his faithful canine sidekick to the world. Wallace is distraught when his cheese supply runs out, so he decides to take a trip to the moon. All he needs to do is build himself a space rocket. With the voice of Peter Sallis

programme.title: Nativity!
programme.desc: A primary school teacher is given the job of directing a nativity play and is determined to outdo a rival from a nearby private school. When he dishonestly claims his ex-girlfriend is a Hollywood producer and is coming to see the show with an eye on making a film, he finds himself becoming a local celebrity. Comedy, starring Martin Freeman and Ashley Jensen

programme.title: Here We Go
programme.desc: Comedy focusing on members of the Jessop family as they navigate a combination of lifes everyday challenges. Paul gives Rachel a family voucher for a theme park which is valid for six months. Just before it reaches its expiry date - and with a neighbours dog in tow - the Jessops finally attempt to use it. Alison Steadman, Katherine Parkinson, Jim Howick, Tom Basden, Freya Parks and Tori Allen-Martin star

programme.title: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Sitcom about a father and daughter reunited when the latter falls pregnant. Exhausted Gemma, living with her three-month-old daughter, sees her formerly estranged mother Davina move in. Instead of helping, her mum lives an irritatingly carefree life. Meanwhile, father Malcolm is living back at the bedsit, sleeping on an inflatable bed on the landing. Missing her dad and in a state of despair, Gemma conspires with Malcolm and Derek to hatch a plot to oust Davina. Starring Aimee Lou Wood, David Morrissey, Jill Halfpenny and Sarah Hadland

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams race from the surf mecca El Zonte on the Pacific coast across the entirety of El Salvador, known as the land of volcanoes, before entering Honduras to reach the third checkpoint, the colonial mountain town of Valle de Angeles. With the gap between teams reduced to just three and a half hours, Anita Rani and Bal Nazran are first to depart, eager to maintain their lead. However, Roman and Harleymoon Kemp hatch a plan to steal first place, by speeding along the coast to enter Honduras by sea

programme.title: Men of the Manosphere
programme.desc: James Blake enters the virtual world of manhood, often referred to as the manosphere, in search of status, wealth and relationships. He meets three young men who have turned to male social media influencers for guidance and instruction as they seek to better themselves and achieve success in different areas of their lives, both on and offline

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The ultimate hunt for the best new British comic begins as 30 hopefuls battle it out across six heats to earn a place at the Final, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Josh Jones hosts the West heat at St Georges, a multi-purpose, fully accessible live music and arts venue in the heart of Bristol. Carwyn Blayney, Will Owen, Omari Douglas, Jess Carrivick and Alfie Dundas take to the stage in a bid to impress judges Priya Hall, Harriet Dyer and Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Sarah Keyworth hosts, as second heat contenders Eli Hart, Farhan Solo, Chloe Reynolds, Will BF and Monica Hsueh take to the stage of Birminghams Hockley Social Club in a bid to book their place in the final. Head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri is joined in her ranks by comedian, writer and podcaster Aurie Styla and local Brum stand-up Lindsey Santoro

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Alexandra Palace in north London, venue of the BBCs first ever television broadcast, stages the south of England heat, as comics Blank Peng, Fab Goualin, Sharifa Butterfly, Sydney May and Evaldas Karosas battle it out to book their place in this years grand final showdown. Host Sara Pascoe is joined by stand-up comics Catherine Bohart and Michael Odewale, who appear alongside Fatiha El-Ghorri on the panel of judges

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The Boiler Shop arts and performance space in Newcastle is the venue for the fourth heat, which sees comics Charlie Ashton, Murph, Zoe Cousin, Caira OConnor and Shugufta Choudhry battling it out to book their place in this years grand final in Bradford. Amy Gledhill hosts the proceedings and the judges for the night are Teesside local Phil Dunning, former winner Dan Tiernan and head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Christopher MacArthur-Boyd hosts the fifth heat at the Barrowland Ballroom in Glasgow, where five acts take to the stage in front of a packed house and judges Daniel Foxx, Susie McCabe and Fatiha El-Ghorri. Ayo Adenekan, Alan Jay, Kate Dolan, Calum Frost and Joe da Costa perform five minute sets in hopes of earning a place in the final at the Alhambra Theatre in Bradford

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Dane Buckley hosts the contest at Mandela Hall, Belfast, where five comics compete in the last of six knockout heats to bag their place in the grand final. Award-winning comedian and podcaster Alison Spittle and former NCA finalist William Thompson join head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri to assess the potential of contenders Eoghan Collins, Pravanya Pillay, Vinny Shiu, Lianna Holston and Jim Midge

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Amy Gledhill hosts the final from the Alhambra Theatre in Bradford, the 2025 City of Culture. The six heat winners take to the stage once more before head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri and her fellow panellists decide who will take this years title of Best New Comedian. Joining her is stand-up comedian Harriet Kemsley and Adjani Salmon, the writer and star of hit comedy Dreaming Whilst Black. Theres also a routine from last years champion Paul Hilleard, before he hands over the trophy to his successor

But when they demand to see him actually do something heroic, Mush-Mush feels he can’t back out.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug and Carrie decide to renew their wedding vows, but preparations for the ceremony throw up more challenges than anticipated - not least the task of finding a chimp to act as best man

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Deacons estranged wife tells Carrie she wants to get back with him. Doug isnt sure whether to reveal this new development to his friend - especially as hes just announced hes going away for the weekend with another woman

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Danny does some gardening work for Carries gynaecologist - but she thinks the doctor might refuse to see her as a patient when she learns how much her friend overcharged him. Guest starring Judge Reinhold

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray keeps visiting Roberts new apartment, which always seems to be swarming with pretty girls - until Debra puts in an appearance and curtails his enthusiasm. Ray Romano stars

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: The spirit of Christmas is in short supply when Ray gives his parents a personalised toaster and they sneak off to exchange it for a coffee machine. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Peter Boyle and Doris Roberts

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is shocked to discover his father let him win a game of table tennis when he was 12, and indignantly demands a rematch, determined to secure a legitimate victory this time. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Peter Boyle and Patricia Heaton

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne offers to cook a romantic dinner to help Niles make amends with Maris after an argument - but ends up stranded with him on a stormy night. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink goes all out to win when he and Roz are nominated for a radio award, but wishes he hadnt after he discovers he is up against a veteran talk-show host who is retiring. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin is furious to learn Frasier has thrown out his favourite chair to make space for a new one, and sends him out to retrieve it. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: As the advancing years begin to take their toll on Frasier, he wonders whether a relationship with a 20-year-old sales assistant would help him recapture some of his youthful vitality. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe takes a gamble on a 1935 classic car thats either a diamond in the rough or a total waste of money. Dave Ohrt unveils a project one year in the making

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Channel 4s midday news summary

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: Three professional chefs in Oxfordshire battle it out in a contest of alfresco asado BBQ cooking, traditional pub grub, and hand-dived Orkney scallops

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon OBrien and Henry Cole head to Buckinghamshire to meet Hugh, who runs a repair and upcycling shop and is in need of a bit of help

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with John Thomson in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against words and numbers

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Keen golfers John and Adele from Bedfordshire have been together for 13 years and want to find the perfect holiday home in Murcia where they can enjoy the Spanish sunshine and golf courses whenever they like. Ben Hillman shows them five options for their budget of £100,000

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: The steep and winding roads cause problems for Francessca and Carl as they try to transport a heavy stove to their forgotten Italian village. Storms hit Hayley and Lees ancient hamlet in Normandy, while Cesidios vineyard, which provides the main source of income at a borgo in Italy, is in danger of drying up

programme.title: Jasmine Harmans Renovation in the Sun
programme.desc: Jon returns to his favourite sport of padel, which feels like a milestone for him, as the last time he was on a court he broke his leg. But with the garden wall still not finished and Jasmine getting called away for a job, all the work is left to Jon

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Rachel is looking for a permanent home in the Limousin region of France, where she can enjoy her retirement. A gorgeously peaceful part of France, Limousin is rich in natural lakes and full of quintessentially French villages. Jean Johansson shows Rachel and her niece Caroline what up to £80,000 can buy, from a dog-friendly doer-upper to a charming hamlet ticking all the boxes

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Rory Peck Awards
programme.desc: Award-winning film-maker James Jones follows whistleblowers and activists who are standing up to Russian president Vladimir Putin, witnessing the loneliness and brutal consequences of those who are determined to expose the tactics of the Russian state. James is a finalist in this years Rory Peck Awards, which celebrate the freelance filmmakers who bring the worlds stories to our screens

programme.title: George Clarkes Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke meets first-time renovators Erin and Oliver, who have spent their inheritance on a dilapidated dung-filled barn outside Harrogate, North Yorkshire. The newlyweds dream is to turn the 200-year-old building into a stunning country home that Erins late father would be proud of. But to do it, they need to overcome the infamous Yorkshire elements

programme.title: Cancer Detectives: Finding the Cures
programme.desc: The work of trailblazing scientists taking on the disease, exploring how their pioneering work is changing patients lives right now. This programme focuses on Professor Sarah Blagden, who is attempting to stop cancer before it even starts. Her pioneering clinical trials feature Trevor, a retired Navy veteran whose skin cancer has spread. Could Sarahs immunotherapy trial save Trevors life? Twenty six-year-old Ella has a genetic condition giving her a 90 per cent chance of developing cancer. Ella hopes to join Sarahs prevention trial and live without fear

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics give their instant reactions to the biggest and best shows shown over Christmas 2019, including Gavin and Stacey, Dracula, Strictly Come Dancing, Jamies Easy Christmas Countdown, Celebrity Catchphrase, Home Alone, Top Gear Christmas Special, A Berry Royal Christmas, A Merry Tudor Christmas with Lucy Worsley, The Chase Celebrity Christmas Special, Jane and Friends: New Years Eve Special and Gremlins

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a combination of the comedy panel show and the long-running words-and-numbers quiz, with Jon Richardson and Big Zuu taking on Danny Dyer and Helen Bauer. Mathematician Rachel Riley looks after the letters and numbers, while Mat Ewins joins lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his two-part challenge at Mangia Mangia in Woodland Park, Colorado. In order to save the struggling Italian restaurant from disaster, he must persuade harassed owner Julie to co-operate with the head chef, and work his magic on a menu that relies heavily on a microwave

programme.title: Summerwater
programme.desc: The drama continues with the Zaliskevicius-Piotrowska family, from Marijonas and Alinas first meeting to their present-day lives at Summerwater - and the tensions that exist within their cabin. An innocent attempt to make friends backfires for Violeta, igniting Alinas worst fears and furthering divides within the family, and Marijonas faces up to the darkest parts of himself, with consequences that will affect the rest of the Summerwater residents

programme.title: Bad Times at the El Royale
programme.desc: In the late 1960s, several strangers, many with a secret to bury, meet by chance at a rundown Lake Tahoe hotel with a dark past. During the course of one night, everyone will show their true colours. Director Drew Goddards mystery thriller, starring Jeff Bridges, Cynthia Erivo, Dakota Johnson and Chris Hemsworth

programme.title: Devon and Cornwall
programme.desc: In east Devon, master wheelwrights Greg and Mike Rowland embark on a new commission - building a gun carriage to sit aboard the HMS Warrior. With wheel building going back centuries in their family, theyre the best people for the job. In the busy fishing town of Newquay in north Cornwall, gig racer Natalie Trebilcock readies herself for a return to the sport after four years spend raising a family. Shes hoping to be picked for a place in one of the top teams, hoping to win the coveted Silver Salver

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet Nitasha and Nikunj in Staines-upon-Thames, who are unsure whether to sell their four-bed dormer bungalow or renovate instead. Having been reluctant to buy it just two and a half years ago, Nitasha has made the place home and believes it has the potential to be perfect for their future family. However, Nikunj feels like the work on the house will never be done, and would prefer to look for somewhere new

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie hears her law firm is laying people off and begins to worry about her job, while Doug lands himself in the doghouse by losing Deacons lucky ball. American comedy, starring Kevin James, Leah Remini and Victor Williams

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie cooks Thanksgiving dinner for 10 people, while Doug takes pity on a stranger who has been left waiting for a lift - but his good intentions backfire. With Leah Remini and Kevin James

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie is made unemployed and initially shows no inclination to find another job. Finally stung into action by a confrontation with Doug, she decides to join Arthur in a new business venture - making mobile phone covers

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie is angry to learn Ray threw a party in her house 20 years previously, and responds by spurning him in favour of Robert. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Doris Roberts and Brad Garrett

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert and Ray are asked to film a video tribute to Frank, who has been named Man of the Year at his lodge, but find none of the other members can stand him

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank is injured just before going on a Caribbean cruise with Marie, so Ray takes his place, sharing a tiny cabin with his mother and being mistaken for her lover. Meanwhile, Robert faces up to the challenge of looking after Frank. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Peter Boyle and Doris Roberts

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Cranes set off on a road trip in a motor home, but Martin complicates matters by inadvertently driving into Canada - which means they have to try to sneak Daphne back across the border due to the terms of her American visa. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, John Mahoney and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier decide to collaborate on a self-help book about sibling relationships. After struggling to write it they lock themselves in a hotel room until it is finished, but petty jealousy reigns and the Crane brothers are soon at each others throats

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Food critic Gil takes over the radio show to cover for an ailing Frasier - who immediately fears his job is under threat and resolves to get back on air without delay. Comedy, starring Edward Hibbert and Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles meets his brother at Cafe Nervosa, where Frasier reflects on his first year in Seattle - and whether he is actually happy with his life in the city. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.sub-title: If You Talk Nice to Me
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe is on a quest to buy a rare cycle car he has coveted for more than two years, but it is going to take a lot of luck and charm to seal the deal

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Channel 4s midday news summary

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: Three sets of chefs serve dinner in Birmingham, where the first venue is seafood restaurant The Oyster Club, hosted by head chef Rosie and front of house Jess

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon OBrien and Henry Cole meet Gaby, whose garden is strewn with interesting items. From a mass of tangled weeds, Henry pulls out a vintage sack barrow, while Simon finds a shepherds stove hidden in the undergrowth

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with John Thomson in Dictionary Corner, as contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against words and numbers

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Medical couple Rooman and Richard dream of buying a holiday bolthole in the sun, for quick getaways whenever they get the chance. Spain has always been their favourite holiday destination, and theyve chosen the coastal town of Fuengirola to find their perfect place. Jean Johansson lines up five properties for their budget of £130,000, but will any be perfect enough for them to put in an offer?

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: In Normandy, Hayley and Lee deal with the fallout from some very wet and windy weather. In Italy, Francessca and Carl juggle running one village with the renovation of another, while Cesidio looks to the future of his borgo and puts plans in place for the next generation to take the reins

programme.title: Jasmine Harmans Renovation in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine and the family have been living in their Spanish villa for over a year while the builders work around them, turning it into a contemporary modern home. With a large summer party planned and guests about to arrive, can they gather momentum for the final push and complete all the work in time?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Keen foodies Jean and Michael are ready to move to Mijas Costa in southern Spain to enjoy its culture and active lifestyle. Mijas boasts gorgeous beaches and has retained its authentic traditional charm with its pretty whitewashed town full of picturesque plazas - the perfect place to enjoy the Spanish lifestyle. Leah Charles-King shows them five great options for their maximum budget of £315,000, from a turnkey treat to a place giving dome-estic bliss

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: In Tenerife, squatters are taking over homes prompting hotels and property owners to turn to hard-man evictors to get them out. The Canary Islands attract 16 million tourists a year, but a deepening housing crisis is turning the Spanish region into a battleground, as people who say they can no longer afford soaring rents are occupying other peoples properties instead. Under Spanish law, once people occupy a property for 48 hours, a court order is needed to evict them - and this can take years. Reporter Anja Popp joins a controversial new force of private eviction teams employed by property owners

programme.title: Rory Peck Awards
programme.sub-title: Ramita Navai - Gaza: Doctors Under Attack
programme.desc: Reporter Ramita Navai tells the stories of the front-line medics who stayed at their posts as their hospitals and clinics became war zones in the Gaza conflict. Ramita is a finalist for the Rory Peck Awards 2025, which celebrate the freelance film-makers who bring the worlds stories to the worlds TV screens

programme.title: Secrets of Supercheap Shopping
programme.desc: Shoplifting surges as food prices climb, prompting OneBeyond founder Chris Edwards to get on top of a problem that is costing both him and his shoppers money. Plus, the price-cutting pet food retailer who is using Goldilocking to ensure his pricing strategy is just right and a test to see whether shoppers can taste the difference between discounted products that are past their best before date and supermarket ones that are still in date

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the weeks biggest and best shows

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by guests including Harriet Kemsley for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. As usual, the hashtag #isitok paves the way for the gang to round up, examine and explain the leading and most entertaining news stories of the week

programme.title: Sarah Millican: Home Bird Live
programme.desc: Stand-up show recorded in 2014 at Newcastles Tyne Theatre and Opera House, in which the comedian shares humorous insights into her life, including the need to put down some roots now she has cats. She also offers advice on what to take away on a dirty weekend, how to teach a pensioner to swear and the correct number of meals to consume in a day

programme.title: Bad Hair
programme.desc: An ambitious young black TV presenter is told that she does not have the right look to make it in the image-obsessed world of music television. She agrees to get a weave to change her look, but finds her fashionable new hairstyle has a deadly mind of its own. Comedy horror, starring Elle Lorraine and Vanessa Williams

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in Redondo Beach, California, for the first of two visits to Zayna Flaming Grill, a Mediterranean restaurant owned and run by aunt and niece Faye and Brenda. Faye believes she has the weight of the entire restaurant on her shoulders, while Brenda feels she isnt treated as an equal in the business. With tensions rising, the food not up to scratch and everyone playing the blame game, the chef is faced with one of the trickiest situations hes ever encountered

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Shelley Guest House in Aberystwyth, where its husband-and-wife owners hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money by providing their guests with an old-school form of entertainment, some Spanish cuisine and a monumental continental breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests travel to the five-star Ixworth House in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, where hosts John and Sharyn Snell are quietly confident their establishment will impress. John reveals his hidden talents at dinner, but his performance at breakfast the next morning does not go down well with all of the fellow BandB owners

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In York, part-time panto dame Graham Smith runs the Georgian House and Mews, and takes his guests back in time with a Nordic test of strength. programme.sub-title: The One with the Sonogram at the End

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica shows off her new boyfriend to the rest of the group, Chandler decides to take up smoking again and Phoebe makes a gruesome discovery that leads to her receiving a windfall. Starring Courteney Cox, Matthew Perry and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The girls end up breaking out binoculars in order to catch a glimpse of a good-looking neighbour with White House connections after accidentally receiving a pizza that he ordered, while Joey and Chandler take Ross to a ice hockey game to keep his mind busy

programme.sub-title: The One with the East German Laundry Detergent

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler begins a relationship with a married woman, Ross tries to liven up his conservative image and Joey lands a film role with a difference - as a naked body-double for Al Pacino

programme.desc: A power cut exposes Chandler to temptation by trapping him in a banks ATM lobby with only a stunning model for company. Ross has a hard time trying to ask Rachel out on a date, and Joey learns something interesting about Monica

Meanwhile, Raj is infuriated when Howard abandons him to pursue a girl at a kite-fighting contest

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: A jealous Leonard argues with Penny when she invites one of her male friends to stay at her apartment while he is in town. Unfortunately, the row brings up unpleasant memories for Sheldon of watching his warring parents, causing even more tension between the friends. Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Raj and Howard go camping to watch the Leonid meteor shower, but the trip takes an unexpected turn thanks to some specially baked cookies. Meanwhile, Penny injures herself in the shower, and with the rest of the gang out of town, its left to Sheldon to come to her aid

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Long-standing TV personality Krusty the Clown reaches the end of the road, his days of entertaining kids quashed by an alternative show - prompting his famous friends to come to the rescue. Animation, with the voices of Elizabeth Taylor, Hugh Hefner, Bette Midler and the Red Hot Chili Peppers

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer recalls his musical heyday as a member of the Be Sharps barbershop quartet, when he performed for President Reagan along with Principal Skinner, Barney and Apu. Featuring the voices of David Crosby and George Harrison

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge is convinced Bart is lying when he denies any responsibility for a bulldozer crash, so she doggedly follows her mischief-making sons every step in the hope he will eventually crumble and confess. Meanwhile, its a case of out with the old and in with the new when Homer gives Santas Little Helper the cold shoulder in favour of Flanders new pooch

programme.title: Animal Control
programme.desc: Emily accompanies Frank on an official Animal Control ride-along, and becomes an unlikely partner in his exotic animal ring investigation

programme.title: Americas Next Top Model
programme.desc: The hopefuls get a lesson in healthy eating before taking part in a photoshoot with live bees, and Ondrei has a revelation for the judges

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows being aired during September 2022, with critiques of The Masked Dancer, Married at First Sight UK, Nadiyas Everyday Baking, Bad Sisters, This Is MY House, Epic Adventures with Bertie Gregory and ITV News

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Deadly (aka David) found fame with his UK garage crew, and though he may be confident on stage, hes shy and retiring with the ladies. Can he bring his A-game when he meet teaching assistant Helen? Other diners include rock fan Anthony, who meets retired nurse and fellow northerner Barbara. Shes an amateur magician with a few dating tricks up her sleeve

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Dating show hosted by Anna Richardson in which two singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who are revealed to them one body part at a time. They then they whittle the candidates down until only one remains. In the first edition, Aina, a music producer from London, wants to find someone adventurous who she can have a deeper connection with, while Guildford-based designer Mal - who has dated men and women - is curious to see who she will be drawn to when all options are laid bare before her. The first episode features Aina, a music producer from London, and Mal, a designer from Guildford

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Amy and Wil Wheaton get into a fight while filming Fun with Flags, Sheldon suffers the consequences of their fall-out. He ends up going to Penny for advice and after getting drunk, confronts the actor in a bid to make him apologise. Bernadette encourages Howard to move out of his mothers house

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends try to solve the mystery of Sheldons post-lunch activities, following him to a secret room where they discover how he chills out. Elsewhere, Leonard is jealous when Penny starts texting a classmate, but things quickly change when Alex gets flirty with him

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows being aired during September 2022, with critiques of The Masked Dancer, Married at First Sight UK, Nadiyas Everyday Baking, Bad Sisters, This Is MY House, Epic Adventures with Bertie Gregory and ITV News

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Prohibition Grille in Everett, Washington, where he meets belly dancer-turned-restaurateur Rishi Brown, who is making all the wrong moves with her business. Distracted from the task of improving her menu by performing for customers, shes oblivious to the disastrous dishes being served from her own kitchen

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: So Its Come to This: A Simpsons Clip Show
programme.desc: Barts latest prank wrecks the house and lands Homer in hospital, where he and the family reminisce about all the other injuries and mishaps he has suffered in his eventful and disaster-filled life

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Brisket, Voodoo and Cannonball Run
programme.desc: The Cooper kids try to come up with ways to resolve a family feud when Meemaw refuses to give George Sr her secret brisket recipe. US comedy, with Iain Armitage, Lance Barber and Annie Potts, and narrated by Jim Parsons (adult Sheldon in The Big Bang Theory)

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: Cape Canaveral, Schrodingers Cat and Cyndi Laupers Hair
programme.desc: In an attempt to bond with Sheldon, George Sr takes the boys on a road trip to see the Space Shuttle launch. Meanwhile, Mary, Missy and Meemaw have a girls weekend at the salon. Narrated by Jim Parsons

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil learns that his real estate class will be cancelled if any additional people drop it, so he turns on his powers of charm and flattery to keep one particular student from leaving. Meanwhile, Jay may unwittingly be flirting with the mother of Joes classmate and tries to set boundaries

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When a member of the communitys behaviour becomes increasingly erratic, Calvin and Dave step up to help. Marty undergoes a dramatic makeover to impress a crush

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave starts researching his genealogy and makes a surprising discovery, while Tina offers to help Gemma when she has morning sickness and stumbles on a new business idea

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.sub-title: Welcome to the Sister from Another Mister
programme.desc: When Gemma hires Alexis to teach at her school, Tina suspects the new teacher may not be quite who she claims to be

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil convinces Jay to spice things up for Gloria on Valentines Day by trying out role play, while Mitch and Cam are forced to make amends when they accidentally ruin Lukes date

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Hayley and family go to her new bosss country house for a wine-tasting trip, but there is a rather bizarre rule, while Gloria and Mitch are invited to a party at Oprahs house

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos on the themes of food and animals

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Arvada, Colorado, where a husband and wife have allowed their restaurant to fall into disrepair. Randys hoarding is out of control, while Alexa, who runs the kitchen, has a lot to learn. To make matters worse, the Old Neighborhood is one of the filthiest eateries the fiery chef has ever seen, and only one of the biggest transformations of the series can save the business

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Queens, New York, where he meets a family torn apart by the stress of running failing Greek restaurant Kati Allo. Husband-and-wife owners Manny and Christine are on the brink of divorce, while their daughter Evelyn is caught in the middle and at her wits end

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Barts dream girl Mary Spuckler comes to town, but their relationship turns sour when he fails to pay her enough attention. Meanwhile, Homer lands himself in the doghouse after upsetting Marge once too often. With the guest voices of Benedict Cumberbatch and Zooey Deschanel

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart and Milhouse sample the perks of adulthood when a shaving experiment leaves one of the boys looking exactly like his father. Meanwhile, a preoccupied Marge tries to protect Maggie from the dangers of childrens TV

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the 200th episode of the comedy, the gang finally celebrates Sheldons birthday after more than nine years together, with the help of a few special guests. Starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with guest appearances from Adam West, Wil Wheaton and Stephen Hawking

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Howard face problems when they file for a patent for their infinite persistence gyroscope. Plus, Penny, Amy and Bernadette give Raj dating advice when Emily reaches out to him after their breakup. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Plans for a relaxed evening at Jays turn out to be anything but when Claire is mad with her dad over his lack of gratitude for her holding the fort at work and Mitchell is busy scheming after receiving a gift he doesnt like. Meanwhile, Phil and Gloria stop off at her old salon and get scissor-happy when a stylist fails to show up

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys and Pritchetts head Down Under for a family holiday so Phil can fulfil his mothers wish that he should one day return to the country where he was conceived. Mitch and Cam meet up with an old friend who is now a big star, but neither of them can stand him, while Jay and Claire let work eat into their vacation time. Rhys Darby (Flight of the Conchords) guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldons obsession with gift-giving etiquette annoys his friends as Christmas approaches. Meanwhile, Leonard is thrilled to meet an award-winning scientist, only to be filled with jealousy when his new colleague takes an interest in Penny. With guest star Michael Trucco (Battlestar Galactica, One Tree Hill)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and the gang are excited when Barry Kripke challenges them to a robot duel. Meanwhile, Howard is devastated when Penny finally tells him what she thinks of his chauvinism. Guest starring John Ross Bowie

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon decides to put his formidable brain power to use in devising a scientific procedure for making friends. However, to prove his findings he must first win the trust of fellow scientist Barry Kripke to gain access to a powerful computer. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and John Ross Bowie

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny runs into money troubles, so Sheldon offers to lend her some cash to help her pay the rent. However, when Leonard discovers his neighbours ex-boyfriend Kurt is the cause of her financial woes, he gathers the gang for a confrontation. Starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The young genius is forced to help Georgie revise for a maths test when poor grades threaten his brothers future on the football team. In doing so, he manages to pick up a few skills himself. US comedy, starring Iain Armitage and Montana Jordan

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: An Eagle Feather, a String Bean and an Eskimo
programme.desc: The young genius moves to Dallas to attend a school for gifted children, the family struggles to cope without him around any more. US comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.sub-title: My Way or the Highway to Heaven

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Baby You Cant Drive My Car
programme.desc: A self-driving car company comes to Springfield, poaching all of the power plant employees with its fun work environment

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howards fear of commitment causes him to avoid Bernadette, but he soon realises he has made a mistake and tries to compensate for it. Meanwhile, Kripke plays a prank during a radio interview with Sheldon, who sets out to get revenge, only to be caught by the Dean. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star, with an appearance by Katee Sackhoff (Battlestar Galactica) as herself

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadette asks Leonard about his physics experiment, making Howard so jealous that she threatens to end their relationship. Penny also feels put out by the situation, and asks Sheldon to teach her about science. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Melissa Rauch star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonards mother visits and he is horrified to learn that Sheldon knows more than he does about his own family, including his parents impending divorce and the death of his dog. Guest starring Christine Baranski

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj lusts after a girl he and Sheldon meet at a university party, and Leonard comes to regret airing his disapproval of Pennys belief in psychics. Comedy, starring Kunal Nayyar and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Psychotic Sideshow Bob is released from Springfield Penitentiary thirsting for revenge - prompting Bart and the rest of the family to join the witness protection programme. Featuring the guest voice of Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A routine check reveals Homer is not qualified to work as a safety inspector at the power plant, so he goes back to college to study for a degree - but spends all his time playing pranks and ends up failing his exams

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A trip down memory lane is on the cards when Homer finds an old film strip, leading to family flashbacks telling the story of Bart and Lisas troublesome toddler years - and how they got into their first fight

programme.desc: Emily hires an expert canine trainer to help with the kennel dogs

programme.title: Americas Next Top Model
programme.desc: The hopefuls receive a makeover before taking part in an Alice in Wonderland-themed photoshoot, but Alexandrias diva-like behaviour causes friction

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt and his team are implicated in a bombing at the Kremlin, forcing the American president to declare them fugitives. The spies plan to clear their name by abducting the real terrorist, which leads them into a pursuit around the globe. However, Hunt cannot be sure his colleagues are trustworthy. Action adventure sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg and Paula Patton

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels undermined when his parking space at the university is allocated to Howard instead, and his determination to cling on to the spot causes a rift in the pairs friendship. However, the battle between the boys pales in comparison to that waged by Amy and Bernadette, whose disagreement on behalf of their significant others becomes increasingly personal. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As part of the relationship agreement, Sheldon reluctantly has to take care of Amy when she gets sick, but she loves the extra attention so much she pretends to remain in poor health. Elsewhere, Howard tries to get some tips on manliness from Penny when he and Bernadette go to visit her father

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. Single mum Tracy from Bedfordshire has been out of the dating game since she split with her fiancee three years ago and hopes to find a man who matches her adventurous side, while London sales adviser Matthew, 24, is tired of dating apps and thinks online profiles mean girls never actually see the real him. programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson visits Alnmouth, Northumberland, which was founded in the mid-12th century after the barons of nearby Alnwick obtained a charter from King John to build a new village. It had a market and a small port and the village flourished - so much so that by the mid-1700s, Alnmouths grain export started to play an integral role in feeding the growing English population

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: In the early 19th century Staithes was as one of the largest east coast fishing ports, and even now the harbour building renovations reveal the seaside villages impressive financial boom. Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the harsh North Yorkshire coastline that surrounds Staithes, as he finds out how the village was built to be a safe haven. It was also a settlement rich in the natural resource of shale. Contributors include local author Peter Appleton and fellow archaeologist Caroline Barrie Smith
