programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: On a Clear Day I Cant See My Sister
programme.desc: Bart drives Lisa to distraction on a school trip, tormenting her until she takes out a restraining order forbidding him to come within 20ft of her. Just to be on the safe side, she uses a pole to make sure he keeps his distance. Meanwhile, Grampa is hurt in an incident involving a garden gnome

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Selma realises her hopes of ever bearing a child are diminishing and flies to China to adopt a baby. Asked to fill in her husbands name on the application, she pretends to be married to Homer - but the company co-ordinator (guest star Lucy Liu) sees through the deception. Also featuring the voices of Robert Wagner and David Silverman

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: Makaukau oe e Paani? (Ready to Play?)
programme.desc: McGarrett and the team hunt for a vigilante when the dead bodies of two serial killers are found on Five-0 property with chess pieces in their mouths, prompting a growing fear grows that tourists arent safe in Hawaii. American crime drama, starring Alex OLoughlin

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.sub-title: No Ke Alii Wahine A Me Ka Aina (For Queen and Country)
programme.desc: The team must work with rogue MI6 agent Harry Langford to find a terrorist planning to cause nuclear reactors across Europe to meltdown, while McGarrett and Danny ask retired FBI profiler Alicia Brown to help them find their vigilante who is murdering serial killers

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: Jessica and Chris go undercover in Mexico, alone and without back-up, to save a Mexican federal agent kidnapped by a drug-dealing gang

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team nvestigates after two men are blown up by their own explosives while attempting to break into a military base. Plus, Callen wants to take the next step with Anna, and Sam moves in with his father Raymond

programme.title: The F1 Show
programme.desc: A preview of the Las Vegas Grand Prix, providing a sneak peek of the paddock and the personalities involved at the heart of the race

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: Michael, Dwight and Jim spy on a rival salesman who has been beating them to clients - and enlist Merediths help to carry out an undercover surveillance mission. Andy forms a band with Darryl and Kevin, but the unlikely trio soon discover they have creative differences. Guest starring Timothy Olyphant (Justified, Deadwood)

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: The employees hold a costume contest for Halloween, but Michaels party spirit is punctured when he discovers Darryl pitched an idea to the management without consulting him first. Pam tries to dispel rumours about her past with Danny. Comedy, starring Steve Carell

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer moves into a camper van parked in the backyard, while Marge retains sole residence of the family home, prompting Bart to take swift action in a bid to reunite them. Unfortunately, his plan entails a perilous drive along the freeway - which culminates in a disaster on board a Turkish container ship

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge tries to bring culture to Springfield by asking architect Frank Gehry (guest starring as himself) to construct a concert hall. However, none of the locals is interested, so Mr Burns decides to turn the disused building into a prison, where Homer soon finds himself confined

programme.sub-title: Retro Efl Cup Final 2009: Manchester United V Tottenham
programme.desc: Manchester United v Tottenham Hotspur in the 2008/09 final. Spurs were managed by Harry Redknapp and had a strong run that led them to the final of the competition, having beaten the likes of Newcastle, Liverpool and Watford in previous rounds. The Red Devils had beaten Middlesbrough, Queens Park Rangers and Blackburn Rovers in the early rounds, before beating Derby County 4-3 on aggregate

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When an undercover FBI agent is killed in the field, the team makes the unnerving discovery that the identities of multiple undercover agents have been compromised, including Maggie who has been actively working to infiltrate an eco-terrorist group. programme.title: FBI: International
programme.desc: An American business executive living in Prague is extorted for millions in cryptocurrency after his family is kidnapped, and Mitchell receives a surprise visit from his ex-girlfriend, FBI Special Agent Ella Driscoll, who wants the Fly Teams help on the case

programme.title: The Rookie

programme.title: Law and Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: An uncompromising, no-nonsense food writer is murdered, and suspicion falls on the owner of a restaurant she was about to criticise in a scathing review. programme.desc: As the chefs Cornish odyssey nears its end, he takes a break in the city of Truro, where he discovers an unusual ghost story and tours the magnificent cathedral. He also meets a family passionate about offal, who prepare Rick a meal of pickled ox tongue and beef heart tacos, and in the countys most northerly parish he tells the story of an eccentric vicar who would retrieve the bodies from nearby shipwrecks and bury them in his church graveyard

Lexie sets out to forget her marital problems by organising Mollys 60th birthday party, but the matriarch is not so keen to celebrate. Meanwhile, Isobel faces financial ruin after a contract to supply the estate with fresh bread and vegetables is cancelled, and Jess is concerned that she and Duncan are turning into a boring couple. Drama, guest starring Tom Baker, with Lloyd Owen, Susan Hampshire and Dawn Steele

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Drug addict Terri Fuller arrives on Jersey with policewoman Liz Phillips under the witness protection scheme, as she is due to testify against her gangster boyfriend. Only Jim and Liz know her exact whereabouts, but a call to London to a journalist puts her pursuers in the picture. Jim foils an attempt to snatch her, but his problems are only just beginning. John Nettles stars

programme.title: The Upper Hand
programme.desc: Charlie encounters an old flame when he takes Caroline to a football reunion weekend, and to escape her attentions pretends he and Caroline are newlyweds. However, he fails to let his wife in on the plan. Kevin Keegan guest stars as himself, with Joe McGann and Diana Weston

programme.title: Terry and June
programme.desc: Terry is persuaded by June to spend a day with his neighbours at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio scheme to get Wally out from under Nora Battys thumb for a day, but come a cropper sneaking him back to the house. Comedy, starring Bill Owen and Joe Gladwin

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio stumble across a health farm on a day out, leading Foggy to devise an ingenious money-making scam - selling food to its famished inhabitants. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest and his friends find themselves stranded with a group of hedonists and are desperate to escape, fearful that their lives are in danger. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A body is discovered in a vineyard and Father Brown is tasked with searching for the murderer among a group of suspects who are all seeking to reinvent themselves. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actresss disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Watermans daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team discovers its prime suspect has a watertight alibi, which narrows the search for the murderer down to the remaining family members. Unfortunately, progress is hampered by the discovery of drug deals and entanglement with the witness protection scheme. Drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Claire Goose

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: When faced with a hefty dentist bill, Lovejoy agrees to settle it by investigating the alleged death by drowning of Terence Sullivan, a fellow antiques dealer. It doesnt take long to determine that Sullivan is still alive, having taken up residence with an attractive stewardess. When Charlotte sees Lovejoys caring side towards the widow, she feels she may have misjudged his character and finally gives in to his seductive charm. Pete Postlethwaite guest stars, with Ian McShane

programme.desc: A summer water shortage presents problems for the locals, especially Alice, whose lack of clean clothes forces her to wear a Wonder Woman outfit instead. programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: The boys join Mrs Linekers Love Bureau hoping to find their perfect love matches. Richies video tells the potential suitors that he is, in fact, a duke and this secures him a date with a countess from Moldavia. Undeterred, he invites her to his place and arranges for Eddie to pretend to be his butler for the evening. Chaotic comedy, written by and starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Richie and Eddies TV is repossessed, giving them ample opportunity to amuse themselves with a series of violent tit-for-tat assaults thinly disguised as games. Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson star

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Its Sunday in the house of the couch-potato clan and Nana calls round. Denise tries on her wedding dress, but nothing can stand in the way of Antiques Roadshow. programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS Children in Need Special 2023
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and his team of volunteer trades and suppliers head to Treetops Hospice in Risley, Derbyshire, for an ambitious Big Build to support and help more children and families experiencing traumatic loss. Radio 2 presenters Scott Mills and Zoe Ball and musician Sam Ryder also don their safety boots, hi-vis and hard hats to get stuck in, while Richie Anderson and Owain Wyn Evans meet some of the young people who have lost loved ones and will benefit from the new building

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine in the hope of winning the £10,000 pound jackpot.

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team travel to Fegg Hayes in Stoke-on-Trent, where Sues family have lived for six generations. To tackle poverty, isolation and mental health problems, they have taken over a patch of wasteland in the heart of the community, with the aim of creating a community garden and centre with room to grow vegetables and space where young and old can share knowledge and experiences. The DIY SOS team are determined to help get the job done, accompanied by hundreds of local tradespeople - only to run into the worst storms to hit Britain in recent years

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke, Katya Jones and Graziano Di Prima join Nick Knowles and the team in Wallsend, Newcastle. Together, they set to work transforming the True Colours performing arts school, an inclusive dance school that teaches dance and theatre skills to 500 children and young adults weekly, many of whom have disabilities and learning needs. The school has grown substantially over time and theyve completely outgrown their existing space, so the team get to work renovating a run-down old boys club that would give the dance school the extra space it so desperately needs to continue to transform more young lives

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS Children in Need Special 2023

programme.title: MasterChef USA
programme.desc: The Top 8 duos face another intimidating team challenge, a VIP dining experience with a twist - they must prepare dishes aboard a moving steam train

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete meets a puppy who needs urgent treatment for a badly broken leg and a young Doberman who has spent most of her life in quarantine kennels

programme.title: Louis Therouxs Altered States
programme.desc: The documentary-maker explores how adoption is a big business in California, meeting agencies, facilitators and lawyers matching babies to parents, with the adoption process often costing as much as $50,000. He meets families that have spent vast sums on children they are unable to conceive themselves, and women preparing to give up their babies, hearing the stories of poverty, addiction and abuse that have inspired their decision. He also discovers how the adoption process is open to abuse, and reflects on what happens when a mother has a post-birth change of heart

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Law and Disorder
programme.sub-title: Louis Theroux: Law and Disorder in Lagos
programme.desc: The journalist meets gangs known as Area Boys as they patrol their neighbourhoods in the Nigerian city of Lagos, clashing with rivals in a bid to keep the peace on the streets. He is taken under the wing of their leader MC, a street youth who is now friends with the most powerful men in the city, and also spends time with the governments paramilitary tasks force, whose ruthless tactics are not that different to those of the gangs

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Three couples who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood and the challenges it has brought them, including Lisa and Will, whose first baby was born with his bowel outside his body. There are also updates on 41-year-old disabled mum Trish, who feared she would not be allowed to keep her newborn, and a couple who were hoping for a girl the fifth time around but instead got another boy

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: Three couples who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood and the challenges it has brought them including Charlie, who gave birth at just 23 weeks to premature twins, baby Mia did not survive and her sister Isobel, who was left fighting for life. Meanwhile, Vicki believed that if she could handle getting a tattoo she could stand the pain of childbirth, and when Sara and Mark first met they already had four teenage children between them. Two years on the couple are now grandparents

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan pretends a quiet Christmas away at a country retreat would be better for Ben than another holiday at home, but her plans to spring a family surprise on him backfire in spectacular fashion. Meanwhile, Nicks friend Alfie is left babysitting Uncle Idris but turns up at the hotel looking for his charge, Michael and Janey bring along unexpected guests, and newly qualified masseuse Abi finds her cousin Ben on the table as her first customer. Feature-length episode of the comedy from 2007, starring Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker, with a guest appearance from John Challis

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Patsy resents Saffys new close relationship with her mother, but is soothed by an encounter with guest star Minnie Driver. Edinas delight at the prospect of having a mixed-race grandchild is topped by her installation of a panic room, complete with champagne and a surveillance system

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A 17-year-old expectant mother suffering from pre-eclampsia has an emergency caesarean, and faces weeks of visits to the neo-natal unit as her premature baby builds the strength to go home. A pair of dentists anxiously await the birth of their child, which they already know will have a cleft lip, and a man who has only been with his partner for five months worries about the prospect of becoming a father

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: People who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood and the challenges it has brought them, including Janet and Vicki, who were looking forward to having a child after four rounds of fertility treatment. A couple who had a girl two years ago reveal how they brought their plans for another baby forward after a cervical cancer scare, and are now expecting a boy. Plus, the chance to catch up with Nicola and Craig, who arrived on the labour ward of the Leeds General Infirmary with strict birthing rules

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: The Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream home renovation at little cost. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as two households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings. Two families are selected from the same region each week and each has a tired room in need of renovation and re-imagining containing a potential treasure trove of up-cycling gems

The couple insist on using only local, seasonal produce, and fish fresh from the sea just yards from their front door. In April, they literally build the place up, and as the summer season ends, they take it down again. As the building is a temporary structure, theres no mains power, so Amy relies on a charcoal oven

programme.desc: Lady Virginia Revel receives a marriage proposal from an ambitious politician, but is reluctant to accept it, especially as she is also being courted by a dashing young suitor. Accompanied by Miss Marple, she travels to a weekend party at her family home Chimneys, hoping to reach a decision. Negotiations for the sale of the country house are taking place during the gathering, but when new owner Count Ludwig of Austria is found murdered, St Mary Meads elderly spinster must identify the culprit. Whodunit, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast including Gavin and Stacey stars Ruth Jones and Mathew Horne, plus Dervla Kirwan, Charlotte Salt, Michelle Collins, Jonas Armstrong and Edward Fox

programme.title: The Chase Australia
programme.desc: Andrew OKeefe presents the Down Under version of the quiz show in which four people must work together to beat the Chaser and win a cash prize

programme.title: John and Lisas Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner prepare some feelgood family favourites, including beef and mushroom stroganoff served with pappardelle, vegetarian chilli and nacho bake with salsa, and one pot teriyaki salmon and noodles served with baked kale crisps. Finally, for pudding, Lisa makes a classically comforting jam roly poly

programme.title: The Six OClock Show
programme.desc: A lively mix of celebrity chat with national and international guests, fabulous food from the countrys top chefs, expert advice and all the unmissable stories making the headlines

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: A severely battered young stray is brought to the shelter in a terrible state - covered in bruises and nasty open wounds - and the staff fear it might have been used as bait in dog fights. Elsewhere, Paul tries to help retired racing dog Willow overcome his fear of stairs so he can be taken home by potential new owners. The comedian also catches up with the Jack Russell-Staffy cross puppies from earlier in the series, and tries to wean them on to solid food - while resisting the overwhelming urge to take them home

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: The comedian meets a neglected six-month-old boxer that was found chained to a tree in a London park, and the Battersea staff go back to basics to train an abandoned and mistreated puppy before rehoming can be considered. Meanwhile, a man brings his two-month-old lurcher to the home, having realised he has taken on too much

programme.title: Animal Emergency
programme.desc: Old English sheepdog puppy Jessie has narrowly avoided death but now must undergo emergency surgery. Elsewhere in the hospital, owner Alan is determined to give his 13-year-old crossbreed Jessica as comfortable life as possible as she battles terminal kidney disease. Coco the alsatian is examined to see if she is a candidate to become a blood donor ,while Mary the heifer is operated on to correct a problem with her leg

programme.title: Zoo Days
programme.desc: The keepers take to the trenches as they compete with a colony of meerkats in an earth-moving contest. Jane Horrocks narrates

programme.title: Zoo Days
programme.desc: Keepers at Chester Zoo provide an insight into the meticulous military-style planning required to feed 7,000 animals every day, and 51-year-old elephant Sheba receives special attention

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Television personality, entrepreneur and model Jo Wood hosts a dinner party for four guests, who win a cash prize if they can guess her identity from cryptic culinary clues. The former wife of the Rolling Stones guitarist Ronnie Wood serves up organic dishes in her home to provide hints for diners. Presented by Brian McFadden

programme.title: The Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream renovation at little cost. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as two households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings. Two families are selected from the same region each week and each has a tired room in need of renovation and re-imagining containing a potential treasure trove of up-cycling gems

programme.title: Britains Biggest Hoarders
programme.desc: Having faced a lifelong struggle trying to help her hoarder mum, Jasmine Harman sets out to help other families struggling with this condition

programme.title: Pressure Pad
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz, hosted by John Barrowman, in which two teams of five players are pitted against each other inside an illuminated arena, known as the Pressure Pad. The team with the most players remaining for the final round will put itself in the strongest position to win the rolling jackpot on offer

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Murdered: The Baby on the Beach
programme.desc: How the discovery of a five-day-old boys body on a lonely Co Kerry beach in April 1984 set in train a chain of events that would bring shame on the-then conservatively minded Irish state and the Gardai. An innocent woman was accused of murdering her child, leading to a tribunal now recognised as a witch hunt

programme.title: Death Row: Countdown to Execution
programme.desc: Susanna Reid travels to Texas to meet convicted killer Billie Wayne Coble in the days leading up to his scheduled execution. In 1989 he pleaded guilty to triple murder and has been on death row ever since. Now 70, he is fighting for a last-minute stay of execution. If it fails, he will be the oldest man put to death in Texas for more than 100 years. Susannah asks Billie to relive the night of the crime and tries to find out how it has affected him and also speaks to his relatives and others involved in the case

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jenny and Dennis are forced to cut short their honeymoon in Spain, and Gina grows increasingly unhappy at the thought of having to give up her job as pub licensee to marry a policeman. Ventress creates a bad impression at the station, and a crooked travel agent finds a way of cashing in on local holiday-makers absence, while Vernon organises a Bentley owners rally at the hall. Sarah Tansey and Duncan Bell star

programme.desc: Head keeper Chas Mackenzie makes sure everything runs smoothly as Chester Zoos amorous black rhinos Emma and Mugadi settle into a breeding scheme

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King explore Fife, on Scotlands east coast, and visit the Harbour Cafe. Amy is the chef who runs this place alongside husband Jack. The couple insist on using only local, seasonal produce, and fish fresh from the sea just yards from their front door. In April, they literally build the place up, and as the summer season ends, they take it down again. As the building is a temporary structure, theres no mains power, so Amy relies on a charcoal oven

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi tries to help Jonathan Davies and Jacquie Noot, who are struggling to attract guests to the 300-year-old Rose and Crown in the market town of Wisbech, Cambridgeshire. programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth investigates the murder of her old friend Father Gorman, using a list of names sent by the priest moments before his death to bring the guilty party to justice. Following a trail of clues to London, Marple is drawn to the Pale Horse Inn - where she discovers a sinister world of occult practices. Drama, starring Julia McKenzie in the title role, with Lynda Baron, Pauline Collins, Nicholas Parsons and Neil Pearson

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A Russian trawlerman found hiding in a local womans shed is accused of being a spy by a Home Office official (The Office star Patrick Baladi) - but Walker and Carol discover the government worker has secrets of his own to hide. Peggy turns detective after an old note found among a dead friends belongings raises questions about her husbands disappearance. With Jonathan Kerrigan and Lisa Kay

programme.title: Waco Untold: The British Stories
programme.desc: The concluding episode of the series bringing together the intimate and emotional stories of the 23 Britons who died in the siege at Waco. As operations to enforce the law on the Branch Davidians began with the US Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms (ATF) and continued with the FBI, the siege ended with the deaths of men, women and children as a deadly fire raged at the groups compound. This episode features personal testimonies and reveals the profound influence that Waco still has today

programme.title: The British Airways Killer
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary examining the disappearance of Joanna Simpson in 2010, telling the story of an investigation that changed British legal history and led to a tragic discovery. The morning after she went missing, her British Airways captain husband Robert Brown made a 999 call to report a domestic issue, but despite handing himself in, he then refused to help the police with their investigation
